quiz.text: Person C and D started a business together. After 10 months, D is replaced by another person F whose investment is Rs. 4640 more than the investment of B. If F worked for 2 months in the business, then find the difference between the profit share of C and F, if the annual profit in the business is Rs. 38,970.
options: Rs. 26,234
Rs. 18,558
Rs. 22,740
Rs. 16,326
None of these

quiz.text: E invested his amount in a scheme which offer 25% per annum compound interest for 3 years while B invested his amount of money in a scooter whose value will decrease at 25% per annum. Find the total amount that E and B will have after 3 years.(approx.)
options: Rs. 43,093.82
Rs. 41,927.97
Rs. 48,865.71
Rs. 45,773.63
None of these

quiz.text: Persons D and B started a business together. After 7 months of the business, they invested Rs. 1000 per month and withdraw Rs. 1500 per month alternatively in the business. If the annual profit earned by them is Rs. 35,343, then find the profit of B in the business out of the total profit.
options: Rs. 23,754
Rs. 14,688
Rs. 18,042
Rs. 26,568
None of these

quiz.text: B and A started a business together. A left the business ‘x’ months before the completion of the year, while B has increased his investment by Rs. 1440 after 8 months and then after 2 more months, he increased his investment by Rs. 2000 again. If the ratio between the profit share of B to A is 2 : 1 respectively, then find the time (in months) taken by A for which he worked in the business.
options: Months
Months
Months
Months
None of these

quiz.text: If A, B, C started a business with a new person X and Y together. X and Y invested Rs. 38,400 each in the business and all of them invested his money for the whole year, then find the average of the profit share of X and Y together is how much percentage more or less than the average profit share of A, B and C together in the business, if the total amount of profit earned by all of them at the end of the year is Rs. 70,200.
options: 13%
15%
17%
21%
None of these

quiz.text: Nitin, Abhishek, and Deepak started a business with some investment. Find the profit share of Abhishek out of the total profit of Rs10000. I. Investments of Nitin, Abhishek, and Deepak were Rs x+100, 2x+300, and x+200 respectively. II. Ratio of profit share of Nitin and Abhishek was 5:2 respectively.
options: Only I
Only II
Both I and II
Either I or II
Cannot be answered

quiz.text: Ram, Shyam, Prakash, and Ankush started a business and invested money in a ratio 10:12:8:9 respectively. They invested the amount for 8 months, 10 months, 6 months, and 12 months respectively. What is the profit of the business at the end of the year?
options: Profit of Ankush is Rs 12960.
Difference between share of Ram and Prakash is Rs 4000 and the difference between their shares out of profit is Rs 2112.
Average of profit of all of them is Rs 19,936.
All of these can answer the question.
None of these

quiz.text:
Sumit and Vijay entered into a partnership business with the capital of Rs. x and Rs. (x + 12000) respectively. After one year Rajesh joined them with the capital of Rs. (x + 8000). At the end of second year Sumit and Rajesh withdraw their capital and Vijay invested for one more year. Sumit, Rajesh and Vijay gets profit in the ratio of 8 : 6 : 21 respectively.

Which of the following can be determined by using the above given data?

I). The value of x.

II). Average of the sum of the capital invested by all the three partners in the business.
options: Only I
Only II
Both I and II
Either I or II
Neither I nor II

quiz.text:
A, B and C entered into a Partnership with investments of Rs. 9000, Rs. 16000 and Rs. K respectively. After 10 months B withdraw 50% of his capital and C added 50% more of his initial capital. After 20 months from start of business A, invested Rs. 3000 more. At the end of 2.5 years, there is a total profit of Rs. 2200. Find the share of profit of C.

Statement I:  profit share of A is 37.5% less than that of C.

Statement II:  Profit Share of B is 33.33% less than that of C.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question
Statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question
Either statement I or II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
Both the statement taken together are necessary to answer the question, but neither of the statement alone is sufficient is sufficient to answer the question.
Both statements I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question

quiz.text: A and B started a business with initial investment of Rs. 4000 and Rs. 2500 respectively. After P months A, left the business and at the end of Q years, ratio of profit share of A and B is 4:5. Find which of the following statement will satisfied the value of (P,Q) in ordered pair. I. 6 months, 1 year II. 4 months, 2/3rd of year III. 5 months, 18 months
options: I only
III only
II only
I and II only
II and III only

quiz.text:
P, Q, and invested in a business. Initial investment of P is 66.66% as that of Q, while initial investment of R is 275% more than that of P. P and Q started together and after 8 months P invested 50% more to his investment, Q invested 66.66% more to his investment and R joined them. If an initial investment of Q is Rs. 12000, and at the end of year total profit is 1.7 lakhs. They donated 25% of profit for education of children.

M = Difference between profit share of P and Q

N = (2500 + difference between profit share of Q and R)

Find which of the following option is true.
options: M > N
M < N
M = N
M + N is not a perfect square
None of these

quiz.text:
Quantity I. A, B and C entered in a business with initial investments of (a + 200), (1.5a - 200) and (1.875a – 250). After 4 months A and C added Rs. 500 more and B withdrew Rs. 1000. The profit of B is Rs. 11250 out of total profit of Rs. 40500. Find the initial investment made by B.

Quantity II. A and B invested Rs. (a + 1400) and (3a – 2400). The profit share of A is 25% more than B at the end of one year. Find the initial investment made by A.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
There are three persons A, B and C investing in a business with initial investments in ratio of 7:5:9. A and B starts the business, after one year A and B made additional investments of Rs. 2000 and Rs. 5000 respectively. After another one year D joins him with investment of 33.33% more than C, and C also joins, B left the business. At the end of 4 years total profit made by all persons is Rs. 121808, and 37.5% of total profit donated to the hospital. Ratio of profit of B and C together to that of D is 39:32.

Quantity I. Find profit Share of B.

Quantity II. Find the value of (profit share of D – Rs. 11740)
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation.

quiz.text:
Quantity I: A and B start a business by investing Rs. 30,000 and Rs. 40,000 respectively. B withdraws his amount after 8 months. If the profit at the end of the year is Rs. 6800, what is the profit share of B?

Quantity II: P starts a business with an investment of Rs. 55,000 and 1 month later Q joins him with an investment of Rs. 60,000. What is the profit share of P at the end of year from a total profit of Rs. 6400?
options: Quantity: I > Quantity: II
Quantity: I ≥ Quantity: II
Quantity: I < Quantity: II
Quantity: II ≥ Quantity: I
Quantity I = Quantity II or relation can't be established

quiz.text: Quantity I: A, B and C start a business with investment in the ratio 6 : 8 : 5 and the ratio of time for them is 12, 15 and 24 months respectively. If the profit after two years is not less than Rs. 7800, what is the share of B? Quantity II: A person has an amount of Rs. X, which increases by 20% then 100% and then it is invested at 10% simple interest for three years. If the interest obtained is Rs. 2160, what is the value of X?
options: Quantity: I > Quantity: II
Quantity: I ≥ Quantity: II
Quantity: I < Quantity: II
Quantity: II ≥ Quantity: I
Quantity I = Quantity II or relation can't be established

quiz.text: P and Q starting a business, with investing the total capital of Rs. 100000, on the condition that Q pays P interest at 10% per annum on 50% of the capital. P is a working partner and receives Rs. 3000 per month from the total profit while remaining profit is equally divided in P and Q. At the end of the year, it was found that income of P is 100% more than that of Q. Find the total profit at the end of the year.
options: Rs. 138000
Rs. 69000
Rs. 92000
Rs. 115000
None of these

quiz.text: A and B entered into a partnership and B’s initial capital is Rs.300 less than A’s initial capital. After 6 months A withdrew Rs.500, after 4 more months B invested Rs.300 more and C joined them with Rs.3000 more than A’s initial capital. If at the end of 12 months ratio of profit shares of B and C is 5: 3 respectively, then find the total initial capitals of A and B together?
options: Rs.3300
Rs.3700
Rs.2500
Rs.3500
Rs.2700

quiz.text: Gagan starting a business with initial investment of Rs. 2400. After 3 months Ganga joins with investment of Rs. 1500 and after another 2 months Gangu joins with initial investment of Rs. 2250. At the end of 10 months total profit is Rs. 1.5 lakhs, 2.4% of total profit is given to Gagan for managing the business rest profit divided in ratio of their investment. Find the profit share of Gangu?
options: Rs. 33600
Rs. 38500
Rs. 36000
Rs. 76800
None of these.

quiz.text: Three persons X, Y and Z investing in a business, ratio of initial investment of Y and Z is 2:3. X and Y started the business and after 4 months Y withdrew Rs. 24000 and X withdrew Rs. 30000 and Z joined the business. Due to work load in business they want to hire another partner. They found person D, but person D is not able to invest in business. D join the business with a condition that there is no share of D in profit but there is monthly salary of Rs. 6000 which is paid by Y and Z equally from their profit share at the end of one year. If Z gets Rs. 1.44 lakhs after paying to D, out of total profit of Rs. 5.31 lakhs, and initial investment of X is 25% more than that of Y, find investment of Y in the business?
options: Rs. 140000
Rs. 120000
Rs. 160000
Rs. 148000
None of these

quiz.text: P and Q entered into a partnership. Q invested Rs.6000 more than P. After 5 months Q withdrew his whole amount and at the end of 15 months, profit share of P is 5/4 times more than that of Q. If initial investment of Q were Rs.6000 more, then what would be the ratio of profit shares of P and Q respectively?
options: 1: 1
4: 3
9: 5
7: 4
5: 4

quiz.text: The total amount invested in the business by A and B is Rs _______. A and B invested in a business in which A invested Rs.3000 more than B. B invested for 6 months while A invested for 4 months. If A get 200 more than B out of a total profit of 1000. T the total amount invested in the business.
options: 16000
19500
20000
21000
22500

quiz.text: Mohan invested Rs 80000 in a Restaurant for the whole year. After 2 months of Mohan, Roman joined him and invested Rs 90000. Next year Mohan invested Rs 15000 more and Roman add Rs 2000 more and at the end of two years profit earned by Mohan is Rs 15900. The total Profit of both is Rs ______  , if they distributed half of the total profit equally and rest in the capital ratio.
options: 16000
68400
20000
19500
None of these

quiz.text: Vicky and Ricky start a business and invest Rs. 9000 and Rs. 22000 respectively. After 6 months, Vicky doubles his investment and Ricky increases his investment by 40%. The Ratio of total profit of Vicky and Ricky by the end of the year is ____:_____.  The profit percentage earned by Ricky is  _____%more than that earned by Vicky?
options: 45:88, 95.5 %
31:49, 81.75%
19:37, 91.75
21:41, 87.5%
49:57, 79.5%

quiz.text: In a business Avesh, Vimal and Yogesh invested some money for the same time. 6/13 of the Avesh investment is equal to the 15/ 26 of Yogesh's investment and Yogesh invested Rs 3000 more than Vimal’s investment and Vimal invested Rs 25000. The ratio of the profit of all three is ___:___:____. The total profit is Rs____ If out of the total profit Avesh gets Rs 5250?
options: 35:25:28, 13200
26:23:28, 20000
20:21:22, 16000
24: 33:25, 17000
22:23:24, 17500

quiz.text: Ramya starts a company and after 3 months, Ravi also joins the company. The initial investment of Ramya and Ravi is in the ratio of 3:2, respectively. Ramya and Ravi receive Rs. _____ and Rs. _____ respectively as profit after completion of one year of the company.
options: 2350, 1350
1960,980
1330,660
1240,310
None of these
